meanings.definition: The arrangement of music for performance by an orchestra.
meanings.sent1: The orchestration of the symphony was beautifully done.
meanings.sent2: The composer spent hours perfecting the orchestration of the piece.
meanings.sent3: The orchestration of instruments in the concert made everyone tap their feet.
meanings.sent4: Her orchestration of the choir's voices created a harmonious blend.
meanings.sent5: The orchestration of the violin solo brought tears to the audience's eyes.

meanings.definition: The coordination or organization of various elements in a complex situation.
meanings.sent1: The successful orchestration of the project required teamwork.
meanings.sent2: The CEO's orchestration of the merger was praised by the board.
meanings.sent3: The orchestration of the office move was like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent4: Her orchestration of the event was like conducting a symphony of tasks.
meanings.sent5: The seamless orchestration of the conference impressed all the attendees.
